intro: Cacalia macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed cacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Cacalia macrocephala is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
